name: Taj Mahal
info: The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum in Agra, built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal between 1632-1653.

name: Pyramids of Giza
info: Built over 4,500 years ago as tombs for pharaohs, the Pyramids of Giza are the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World and the only one still standing.

name: Colosseum
info: The Colosseum in Rome, completed in 80 AD, could hold 50,000 spectators and hosted gladiatorial contests, mock sea battles, and public spectacles.

name: Machu Picchu
info: Built in the 15th century and abandoned during the Spanish conquest, Machu Picchu sits at 2,430 meters above sea level in the Andes Mountains.

name: Sundarbans
info: The world's largest mangrove forest covering 10,000 square kilometers, home to the Bengal Tiger and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Grand Canyon
info: Carved by the Colorado River over millions of years, the Grand Canyon stretches 277 miles and reaches depths of over a mile.

name: Eiffel Tower
info: Built by Gustave Eiffel for the 1889 World's Fair, this 330-meter iron tower is the most iconic symbol of Paris.

name: Great Wall of China
info: A series of fortifications built over 2,000 years to protect Chinese states, stretching over 13,000 miles across northern China.

name: Statue of Liberty
info: A colossal neoclassical sculpture on Liberty Island in New York Harbor, a gift from France symbolizing freedom and democracy.

name: Angkor Wat
info: The largest religious monument in the world, built in the 12th century as a Hindu temple, later converted to Buddhism.

name: Petra
info: An archaeological city famous for its rock-cut architecture, known as the 'Rose City' due to the color of the stone.

name: Stonehenge
info: A prehistoric monument in England consisting of massive standing stones arranged in a circular pattern, built around 3000 BC.

name: Christ the Redeemer
info: An Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, standing 30 meters tall atop Corcovado mountain.

name: Acropolis of Athens
info: An ancient citadel containing the remains of several historically significant buildings, including the Parthenon.

name: Mount Everest
info: The world's highest mountain at 8,849 meters above sea level, located in the Himalayas on the Nepal-China border.

name: Victoria Falls
info: One of the largest waterfalls in the world, known locally as 'The Smoke That Thunders', over 1,700 meters wide.

name: Forbidden City
info: A palace complex in Beijing that served as the imperial palace for 24 Chinese emperors during the Ming and Qing dynasties.

name: Sagrada Familia
info: A large unfinished Roman Catholic church in Barcelona designed by Antoni GaudÃ­, construction began in 1882.

name: Sydney Opera House
info: A multi-venue performing arts center with a distinctive shell-like design, completed in 1973 and now a UNESCO site.

name: Amazon Rainforest
info: The world's largest tropical rainforest covering 5.5 million square kilometers, containing 10% of the world's species.

name: Burj Khalifa
info: The world's tallest building at 828 meters with 163 floors, located in Dubai and completed in 2010.

name: Alhambra
info: A palace and fortress complex in Granada showcasing Islamic architecture from the Nasrid dynasty.

name: Hagia Sophia
info: Built in 537 AD as a Christian cathedral, later converted to a mosque, now a museum showcasing Byzantine architecture.

name: Chichen Itza
info: A large pre-Columbian city built by the Maya civilization, featuring the famous El Castillo pyramid.

name: Neuschwanstein Castle
info: A 19th-century Romanesque Revival palace built by King Ludwig II, inspiration for Disney's Sleeping Beauty Castle.

name: Easter Island Moai
info: Monolithic human figures carved by the Rapa Nui people between 1250 and 1500, nearly 1,000 statues exist.

name: Yellowstone National Park
info: The first national park in the world, famous for its geothermal features including Old Faithful geyser.

name: Mont Saint-Michel
info: A tidal island and monastery in Normandy, accessible by causeway only during low tide, built in the 8th century.

name: Terracotta Army
info: A collection of over 8,000 terracotta sculptures depicting the armies of Qin Shi Huang, buried with him in 210 BC.

name: Santorini
info: A volcanic island in the Aegean Sea, famous for its white-washed buildings with blue domes and stunning sunsets.
